intro: Styloncerus suberectus, commonly known as the erect styloncerus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, upright leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually yellow or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native environment.
